sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system or equipment for producing and delivering power.

sub_subsystems.title: Main propulsion drives, General
sub_subsystems.definition: The propulsion prime mover. It includes, for example, nuclear, electrical, steam, gas turbine and diesel primary propulsion drives.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion nuclear
sub_subsystems.definition: A nuclear fuelled propulsion prime mover

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion electrical
sub_subsystems.definition: An electrically powered propulsion prime mover.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion steam
sub_subsystems.definition: A propulsion prime mover driven by steam. It includes, for example, boilers, hoppers and turbines.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion gas turbine
sub_subsystems.definition: A gas turbine powered propulsion prime mover.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion diesel
sub_subsystems.definition: A propulsion prime mover fuelled by diesel.

sub_subsystems.title: Secondary propulsion drives, General
sub_subsystems.definition: A secondary means of providing propulsion.

sub_subsystems.title: Emergency propulsion drives, General
sub_subsystems.definition: An emergency means of providing propulsion.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion transmission systems, General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system that transmits torque (main/secondary/emergency) to the platform's propulsion drive.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion gearing
sub_subsystems.definition: A system that converts torque, speed or rotational direction between the propulsion and the drive system.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion clutches and couplings
sub_subsystems.definition: A system that connects or removes the drive from the propulsion system.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion shafting
sub_subsystems.definition: A means of transmitting drive from the propulsion system.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion bearings
sub_subsystems.definition: A means of support for propulsion shafting.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion propulsors/propellers
sub_subsystems.definition: A means of converting propulsion energy into movement of the platform.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion support systems, General
sub_subsystems.definition: Ancillary systems in support of a platforms prime mover.

sub_subsystems.title: Circulating and cooling systems
sub_subsystems.definition: This system includes cooling air ducting, coolant pumps, liquid filled radiators, fans and associated heat exchange equipment.

sub_subsystems.title: Uptakes and down takes
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to a system which supplies and filters air to the propulsion system and collects and removes exhaust gases from the propulsion system. It includes, for example, funnels, all filters, pipes, couplings, silencers, catalytic converters, ducting and combustion air systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion fuel systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Equipment to provide fuel storage facilities, fuel filters, delivery pipes, drainage and cut-off valves, Fuel Injector Pumps (FIP) and injectors.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion lubricating systems
sub_subsystems.definition: This system includes lubrication storage facilities. It includes delivery and return pipes, sumps and heat exchangers.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion lubrication transfer and purification
sub_subsystems.definition: This system includes lubrication pumps and filters.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion control systems, General
sub_subsystems.definition: Systems designed to control the various propulsion modes of a platform.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion control systems automatic
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to those systems that automatically control propulsion.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion control systems manual
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to those systems that manually control propulsion.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion control systems - Alarms (General)
sub_subsystems.description: Systems that are designed to provide alarms on propulsion systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Automatically control propulsion - Alarms
sub_subsystems.description: Refers to those systems that automatically control propulsion.

sub_subsystems.title: Manually control propulsion - Alarms
sub_subsystems.description: Refers to those systems that manually control propulsion.

sub_subsystems.title: Propulsion modes of a control systems - Data logging (General)
sub_subsystems.description: Systems designed to control the various propulsion platform.

sub_subsystems.title: Automatically control propulsion - Data logging
sub_subsystems.description: Refers to data logger systems of automatically controlled propulsion.

sub_subsystems.title: Manually control propulsion - Data logging
sub_subsystems.description: Refers to data logger systems of manually controlled propulsion.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Framework and/or basic structural housing for a system, including load bearing components.

sub_subsystems.title: Hull, General
sub_subsystems.definition: Structured contained envelope providing the overall platform for systems, weapons and personnel.

sub_subsystems.title: Hull fittings
sub_subsystems.definition: Fittings that are permanently attached to the hull of a platform.

sub_subsystems.title: Hydrofoils
sub_subsystems.definition: A structure designed to raise the hull out of the water when in motion enabling it to travel fast and economically.

sub_subsystems.title: Main supporting structures, General
sub_subsystems.definition: Beams and columns that provide support for load bearing decks/bulkheads.

sub_subsystems.title: Transverse frames
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to a frame that runs athwart ships.

sub_subsystems.title: Longitudinal frames
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to a frame that runs fore and aft.

sub_subsystems.title: Superstructure
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to a structure that is above deck level. This does not include masts, towers, derricks etc.

sub_subsystems.title: Special structures, General
sub_subsystems.definition: Structures that are not main supporting but are integral to platform design (eg, sonar domes).

sub_subsystems.title: Structural castings, forgings and welding
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to castings, forging and welding which form part of the structure.

sub_subsystems.title: Ballistic plating, sonar domes and stacks
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to armour plating, covers for sonar sensors and funnels.

sub_subsystems.title: Special purpose closures and structures
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to other structures not covered above.

sub_subsystems.title: Bulkheads/decks, General
sub_subsystems.definition: Vertical/horizontal structures, which divide the interior of the hull into compartments or spaces with provision for personnel/stores access.

sub_subsystems.title: Watertight/non watertight bulkheads
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to all bulkheads.

sub_subsystems.title: Main decks
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to all main decks.

sub_subsystems.title: Floors
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to a deck in a land-based structure.

sub_subsystems.title: Masts, General
sub_subsystems.definition: Exterior vertical structures which carry those items of equipment (or stores) which by their nature require to be given height well above the deck areas of the platform.

sub_subsystems.title: Submarine masts and periscope integration
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to masts and periscopes fitted to a submarine.

sub_subsystems.title: Fixed masts
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to solid structures that are fixed to a superstructure.

sub_subsystems.title: Service platforms
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to service platforms that are mounted on masts.

sub_subsystems.title: Towers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to lattice (mast type) structures.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to interior and exterior access points.

sub_subsystems.title: Doors
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to hinged or sliding covers for access points in a bulkhead. May be Watertight and/or Airtight.

sub_subsystems.title: Hatches
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to square or rectangular access point in the deck. May be Watertight and/or Airtight

sub_subsystems.title: Scuttles
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to round watertight openings and covers in a bulkhead.

sub_subsystems.title: Covers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to something that protects hatches or scuttles. May be Watertight and/or Airtight.

sub_subsystems.title: Portable Plates
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to Removable Plates and/or Panels which are integral parts of the ships structure that are secured with bolts and/or screws to allow access for maintenance.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A defensive or offensive system or equipment.

sub_subsystems.title: Gun systems, General
sub_subsystems.definition: An integrated system for platform protection and destruction of the aggressor. Additionally will include Small Arms for personal protection and aggression.

sub_subsystems.title: Gun mountings
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to that part of a weapons system that secures the barrel/breach assembly.

sub_subsystems.title: Directors
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to that part of a weapon system that allows for aiming of the gun.

sub_subsystems.title: Ancillaries
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to that part of a weapon system that is not described above.

sub_subsystems.title: Small arms
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to personal weapon systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Portable weapons
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to portable weapon systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Guided missile systems, General
sub_subsystems.definition: Equipment to deliver a self propelled warhead that can be guided through its flight to a target.

sub_subsystems.title: Control
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to that part of the guided weapon system that provides control.

sub_subsystems.title: Aerials
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the aerials of the guided weapon system.

sub_subsystems.title: Radars
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the target acquisition and guidance radar equipment within the guided weapon system.

sub_subsystems.title: Launchers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the launching equipment within the guided weapon system.

sub_subsystems.title: Ancillaries
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to all parts of the guided weapon system not described above.

sub_subsystems.title: Rocket systems and pyrotechnics, General
sub_subsystems.definition: Projectiles which are used as an aid, signal or illumination.

sub_subsystems.title: Signals
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to those projectiles used for signaling.

sub_subsystems.title: Aircraft related weapon systems, General
sub_subsystems.definition: For protection in the surveillance role and additionally equipment to provide the ability to deliver/fire weapons to selected targets.

sub_subsystems.title: Aircraft weapon systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to weapon systems mounted on an aircraft.

sub_subsystems.title: Aircraft weapon control system
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the control system of an aircraft mounted weapon.

sub_subsystems.title: Fire control systems, General
sub_subsystems.definition: Equipment provided to fire weapons according to the protection or aggression scenario.

sub_subsystems.title: Weapon direction systems and sights
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to that part of a weapon system that directs fire to a given target.

sub_subsystems.title: Gun fire control systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the control system of a weapon system.

sub_subsystems.title: Missile fire control systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the fire control systems for missiles.

sub_subsystems.title: Underwater fire control systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to fire control systems for underwater weapon control systems.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The equipment provided for the discharge of torpedoes to their targets in a timely and controlled manner.

sub_subsystems.title: Submarine torpedo systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the submarine torpedo systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Surface launch torpedo equipment
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the surface launch systems for torpedoes.

sub_subsystems.title: Torpedo handling and stowage
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the handling and stowage facilities for torpedoes.

sub_subsystems.title: Acoustic
sub_subsystems.definition: That portion of the system that uses sound to acquire information. It includes listening devices, amplifiers, processors, indicators etc

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Those units and components which furnish a means of detecting, analyzing, jamming, or nullifying the effectiveness of defensive detection devices and communication links.

sub_subsystems.title: Active
sub_subsystems.definition: That portion of the system consisting of receivers, transmitters, repeaters, blanking and modulating devices (eg, infra-red, laser).

sub_subsystems.title: Passive
sub_subsystems.definition: That portion of the system that contains no active elements (eg, chaff).

sub_subsystems.title: Data processing
sub_subsystems.definition: That portion of the system that processes and analyses received data.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system or equipment for generation, distribution and/or control of electric power.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Power produced to satisfy all electrical power requirements using a generator driven by a prime mover.

sub_subsystems.title: Turbo generators and control equipment
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the control equipment for turbo generators.

sub_subsystems.title: Gas turbine generators and control equipment
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the control equipment for gas turbine generators.

sub_subsystems.title: Diesel generators and control equipment
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the control equipment for diesel generators.

sub_subsystems.title: Motor generators
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to motor generators.

subsystems.title: Primary supply and distribution systems, General

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the primary supply and distribution systems of electrical power.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the converted electrical power supplies.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Lighting equipment that is powered from the mains electrical distribution systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Cabling
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the cabling used in electrical power systems.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The equipment that provides alternative/back-up electrical supplies for use with certain electrical circuits in the event of a power failure.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Emergency supply systems for use in the event of 'normal' power supply failure.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Systems designed to provide safe and effective control of electrical power requirements.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Static and limited (dc) electrical power sources used to provide main, secondary, emergency and/or back-up supplies, additionally to provide supplies to certain portable electrical equipment.

sub_subsystems.title: Primary batteries
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to all primary batteries.

sub_subsystems.title: Secondary batteries
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to all secondary batteries.

sub_subsystems.title: Battery charging systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the charging systems for all batteries.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The communications element refers to that equipment fitted to a platform which provides the means to receive information from off-ship source, to transmit to off-ship receivers and to distribute information throughout the ship.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The shipboard communications system/equipment using super and extra high frequency carriers.

sub_subsystems.title: Aerials
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the SHF/EHF aerials used in a communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Aerial multicouplers and tuners
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the aerial multi-couplers and tuners of an SHF/EHF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Receivers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the receiver equipment of an SHF/EHF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Transmitters
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the transmitter equipment of an SHF/EHF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Transceivers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the transceiver equipment of an SHF/EHF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Ancillaries
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to all parts of an SHF/EHF communications system not detailed above. It includes, for example, patching facilities, modems and other ancillary equipment.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The shipboard communications system/equipment using very high frequency carriers.

sub_subsystems.title: Aerials
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the UHF/VHF aerials used in a communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Aerial multicouplers and tuners
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the aerial multi-couplers and tuners of a UHF/VHF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Receivers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the receiver equipment of a UHF/VHF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Transmitters
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the transmitter equipment of a UHF/VHF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Transceivers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the transceiver equipment of a UHF/VHF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Ancillaries
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to all parts of a UHF/VHF communications system not detailed above. It includes, for example, patching facilities, modems and other ancillary equipment.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The communication system/equipment using high and medium frequency carriers.

sub_subsystems.title: Aerials
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the HF/MF aerials used in a communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Aerial multicouplers and tuners
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the aerial multi-couplers and tuners of an HF/MF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Receivers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the receiver equipment of an HF/MF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Transmitters
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the transmitter equipment of an HF/MF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Transceivers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the transceiver equipment of an HF/MF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Ancillaries
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to all parts of an HF/MF communications system not detailed above. It includes, for example, patching facilities, modems and other ancillary equipment.

sub_subsystems.title: LF/VLF, General
sub_subsystems.definition: The shipboard communications system/equipment using low and very low frequency carriers.

sub_subsystems.title: Aerials
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the LF/VLF aerials used in a communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Aerial multi-couplers and tuners
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the aerial multi-couplers and tuners of an LF/VLF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Receivers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the receiver equipment of an LF/VLF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Transmitters
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the transmitter equipment of an LF/VLF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Transceivers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the transceiver equipment of an LF/VLF communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Ancillaries
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to all parts of an LF/VLF communications system not detailed above. It includes, for example, patching facilities, modems and other ancillary equipment.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The shipboard communications system/equipment that is used for integration distribution and control of communications.

sub_subsystems.title: Control outfits
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the control equipment for the shipboard communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The shipboard communications system/equipment that is used for digital data transmission and reception. It includes, for example, modems, encryption devices and teletypes.

sub_subsystems.title: Cryptographic receivers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the receiver encryption devices.

sub_subsystems.title: Cryptographic transmitters
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the transmitter encryption devices.

sub_subsystems.title: Teletype/message handling
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the teletype and message handling devices that form part of the shipboard communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Tele-printers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the tele-printers used in a shipboard communications system

sub_subsystems.title: Modems
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the modems used in a shipboard communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Displays
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the visual display equipment used in a shipboard communications system.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The shipboard communications system/equipment that provides communications within the confines of the platform.

sub_subsystems.title: Broadcasts
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the shipboard broadcasting and public address systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Inter-communication
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the shipboard intercommunications system.

sub_subsystems.title: Networks
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to all shipboard networks. It includes, for example, Local Area Networks (LAN), Wide Area Networks (WAN), etc.

sub_subsystems.title: Recreational
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to all shipboard domestic electronic devices. It includes, for example, radios, televisions and video recorders, etc.

sub_subsystems.title: Alarms
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the shipboard alarm systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Control
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the control equipment used for shipboard communications systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Telephones
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the telephone equipment used on shipboard communications systems.

subsystems.title: Flight control and instrument landing systems, General

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Communication equipment provided for the safe take-off, operation and landing of aircraft.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system or equipment used to determine, conduct, manage or plot a position or course for the system.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the navigation equipment fitted to a platform that is independent of ground stations and orbiting satellites (eg, NATO SINS, compasses, Log Systems, wind gear).

sub_subsystems.title: Gyro compasses
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to compasses using gyro principles.

sub_subsystems.title: Magnetic compasses
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to all compasses using magnetic principles.

sub_subsystems.title: Inertial
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to all aspects of inertial navigation. It includes, for example, inertial platforms and gyroscope assemblies, etc.

sub_subsystems.title: Speed and distance
sub_subsystems.definition: Ship speed and distance systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Depth
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to shipboard depth determining systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Wind speed and direction
sub_subsystems.definition: Systems to measure and indicate wind speed and direction. It includes, for example, standard wind gear and lightweight wind gear.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the navigation equipment fitted to a platform that is dependent on ground stations and orbiting satellites. It includes, for example, Global Positioning System, Hyper fix, etc.

sub_subsystems.title: Satellite
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the satellite navigation equipment fitted to a platform.

sub_subsystems.title: Radio
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the radio navigation equipment fitted to a platform.

sub_subsystems.title: Radar
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the radar navigation equipment fitted to a platform.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the navigation equipment fitted to a platform which combines/processes navigational data to compute or manage the platforms geographical position. It includes the ship data distribution systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Plotting
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to those navigational aids used for plotting.

sub_subsystems.title: Data distribution
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to that equipment used for the distribution of navigational data.

sub_subsystems.title: Data retransmission
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the equipment used for the retransmission of navigational data.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to that portion of equipment fitted to a platform which senses, monitors and, where required provides alarms and environmental data. It includes, for example, radar, sonar, thermal, optical and environmental technologies.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to that part of the surveillance equipment fitted to a platform that processes and controls the sensor systems. It includes combat systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Data processing
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the equipment used for the processing surveillance data.

sub_subsystems.title: Displays
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to that equipment used to visually display surveillance data.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to that part of the surveillance equipment fitted to a platform that uses radar devices to acquire information. It includes, for example, aerial outfits and surveillance radar.

sub_subsystems.title: Aerials
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the aerials used as part of radar surveillance.

sub_subsystems.title: Receiver
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the receiver equipment used as part of radar surveillance.

sub_subsystems.title: Transmitter
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the transmitter equipment used as part of radar surveillance.

sub_subsystems.title: Ancillaries
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the ancillary equipment used as part of radar surveillance.

sub_subsystems.title: Distribution
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the equipment used to distribute radar surveillance data.

sub_subsystems.title: Displays
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the equipment used to visually display radar surveillance data.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to that part of the surveillance equipment fitted to a platform that uses sonar devices to acquire information

sub_subsystems.title: Transducers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the transducers used as part of sonar surveillance.

sub_subsystems.title: Receiver
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the receiver equipment used as part of sonar surveillance.

sub_subsystems.title: Transmitter
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the transmitter equipment used as part of sonar surveillance.

sub_subsystems.title: Ancillaries
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the ancillary equipment used as part of sonar surveillance.

sub_subsystems.title: Distribution
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the equipment used to distribute radar sonar data.

sub_subsystems.title: Displays
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the equipment used to visually display sonar surveillance data.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to that part of the surveillance equipment fitted to a platform that is used to detect and identify EM emissions.

sub_subsystems.title: ESM aerials
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to aerials used for Electronic Surveillance Measures (ESM).

sub_subsystems.title: ESM receivers
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to receivers used for Electronic Surveillance Measures (ESM).

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to that part of the surveillance equipment fitted to a platform that uses optical devices to acquire information. It includes, for example, periscopes and GPEOD.

sub_subsystems.title: Thermal imaging
sub_subsystems.definition: This element refers to that equipment (hardware/software) which provides a thermal picture surveillance and weapon guidance. It includes thermal imaging sensor heads, drive units, processors, sights, power supply units, and display units.

sub_subsystems.title: Periscopes
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the periscopes used as part of the optical surveillance equipment.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to that part of the surveillance equipment fitted to a platform that provides data transfer capabilities. It includes, for example, data highways and combat system highways.

sub_subsystems.title: Data highway
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the digital data busses used as part of the surveillance system.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Surveillance equipment provided for the selection and identification of friendly and hostile targets.

sub_subsystems.title: Radar aerials
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the radar aerials used as part of the identification system.

sub_subsystems.title: Integrators transponders
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the shipboard, built-in transponders used as part of the identification system of the surveillance system.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to those units and devices within the platform which govern movement and/or direction of assemblies. It includes, for example, motors, gearboxes, drives, thrusters and rudders.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The system designed to transmit the requirements given at the steering position, to the receiver that controls the movements of the rudders or other steering mechanisms.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Power units fitted in the ship below the surface to give lateral thrust when maneuvering the ship.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The equipment provided to minimize the effect of wave movement on a ship.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The system designed to control the submerged depth of a submersible

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Equipment provided to control the attitude of a submersible underwater.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system or equipment used to provide a controlled environment

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Equipment provided to control climatic/environmental conditions within a given space.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Air supply and exhaust systems which provide habitable conditions in working and living spaces within a platform.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Systems which control the humidity and temperature of living spaces, and some working spaces within a platform.

sub_subsystems.title: Compartment heating systems
sub_subsystems.definition: That portion of the system and its controls which supply heat. It includes items such as heater units, wiring, etc.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A machinery plant that generates oxygen which can be stored in liquid or gaseous form.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system or equipment for generation, distribution and/or control of hydraulic power.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Equipment required to provide fluidic power for a prime mover/requirement.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Equipment required to provide fluidic power for the control of engineering systems and machinery.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Systems that are designed to move and store air under pressure.

sub_subsystems.title: Servo air systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Systems that move under air under pressure.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system or equipment using electronic/automated software and/or firmware elements not included in other systems.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system that uses electrolysis for the protection of a ships hull against wastage caused by the corrosive effect of salt water.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system designed to neutralize the magnetic field surrounding a platform.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Subsidiary systems that provide services or support to main systems or equipment.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The equipment provided for the safe movement of aircraft within the hangar or to and from the flight deck or runway.

sub_subsystems.title: Aircraft handling systems servicing and stowage
sub_subsystems.definition: Aircraft handling and associated support facilities.

sub_subsystems.title: Aircraft recovery support systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Aircraft recovery and associated support facilities.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Systems to provide firefighting, machinery cooling, controlled flooding of watertight compartments and some domestic services.

sub_subsystems.title: Firemain and flushing systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Piping, firemain and flushing pumps, and controls.

sub_subsystems.title: Sprinkler systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Sea water sprinkler systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Pre-wetting systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Countermeasure pre-wetting systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Auxiliary sea water systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Auxiliary machinery sea water system pumps and associated pipes, controls, etc.

sub_subsystems.title: Scuppers and deck drains
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to scuppers, deck drains and associated equipment.

sub_subsystems.title: Plumbing and drainage
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to drains, plumbing and associated pipes, control valves, etc.

sub_subsystems.title: Drainage and ballasting systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to piping, drainage and ballasting system, pumps and controllers.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to systems provided for domestic purposes and other services, where the corrosive effect of sea water would be unacceptable.

sub_subsystems.title: Distilling plant
sub_subsystems.definition: Flash type, vapor compression, heat recovery and submerged tube type.

sub_subsystems.title: Auxiliary fresh water cooling
sub_subsystems.definition: Cooling water, electronics, DW/CW.

sub_subsystems.title: Potable water
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to fresh and distilled water services. It includes, for example, drinking water supplies.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to systems that are designed to move and store propellant and lubricating fluids.

sub_subsystems.title: Ship fuel and fuel compensating systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Ship fuel filling and transfer system pumps, fuel transfer systems and associated equipment.

sub_subsystems.title: Aviation and general purpose fuels
sub_subsystems.definition: Piping aviation and general purpose fuel system pumps, aviation and general purpose fuel MOGAS handling and piping.

sub_subsystems.title: Aviation and general purpose lubricating oil
sub_subsystems.definition: Lubricating oil systems, aviation and general purpose.

sub_subsystems.title: Auxiliary lubrication systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Lubrication outboard and lubrication inboard.

sub_subsystems.title: Special fuel and lubricants handling and storage
sub_subsystems.definition: Handling and storage systems for special fuel and lubricants.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Systems that are designed to move and store air and certain gases, under pressure.

sub_subsystems.title: Compressed air systems
sub_subsystems.definition: This element refers to a system or equipment (hardware/software) for the generation, distribution and/or control of pneumatic power and compressed air.

sub_subsystems.title: Compressed gases
sub_subsystems.definition: Compressed gas system nitrogen.

sub_subsystems.title: Vacuum systems
sub_subsystems.definition: This element refers to a system or equipment (hardware/software) for the generation, distribution and/or control of vacuum power.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Cargo handling machinery and systems which are used for replenishment.

sub_subsystems.title: RAS systems
sub_subsystems.definition: RAS Winches, RAS booms, rigging and hardware, control stations.

sub_subsystems.title: Vertical replenishment systems
sub_subsystems.definition: VETREP systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Ships stores and equipment handling systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to ships stores and equipment handling systems.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Any item of machinery other than those directly associated with weapons system not identified elsewhere.

sub_subsystems.title: Engineering and functional machinery
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to engineering and functional machinery.

sub_subsystems.title: Domestic machinery
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to machinery installed for domestic purposes.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Any item of machinery other than those directly associated with deck machinery.

sub_subsystems.title: Cranes
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to cranes used on deck.

sub_subsystems.title: Winches
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to winches used on deck.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system or equipment used to provide hazard detection, protection, survivability and escape facilities

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Equipment for the limitation, control and repair (within the platform resources) of material damage however caused in peace and war.

sub_subsystems.title: Detection systems
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to equipment for the detection of material damage.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The facilities that are fitted specifically to assist in escaping from danger or to prolong life in times of crisis. It includes, for example, BIBS and HIS

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The equipment that provides the ability to limit the spread of fire, extinguish and prevent re-ignition. It includes, for example, detecting, indicating and extinguishing systems.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: The NBC element refers to those subassemblies or components which provide nuclear, biological and chemical detection, protection and survivability to the platform and crew, either individually or collectively, during an NBC attack. This includes positive pressure and purification systems, ventilated face pieces (masks), NBC detection and warning devices, decontamination equipment and chemical resistant coatings.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to systems for the performance of salvage operations.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to systems for the provision of stability, following damage to or flooding of compartments.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system or equipment used to provide a special mission capability.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: This element refers to that special equipment (hardware/software) to enable the achievement of a special mission capability.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: This element refers to that special recovery equipment (hardware/software) to enable the achievement of a recovery capability. It includes cranes, winches and towing equipment.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: This element refers to that special fit equipment (hardware/software) to enable the achievement of a specialized capability.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: This element refers to that special-to-purpose equipment (hardware/software) for the achievement of a special mission purpose. It covers, for example, equipment for repair workshops, medical and other special purpose platforms.

subsystems.title: Outfit, Furnishings and stowage system, General

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A function or equipment used to provide habitability, operability or stowage facilities that is not specifically included in other systems.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Coverings made from weatherproof fabrics, plastics and synthetics to protect items of exposed equipment and machinery from the elements (particularly salt water spray)

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Protective paint (usually oil based and anti fouling) applied to surfaces which are exposed to sea water or other corrosive elements.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Spaces that are designed to hold stores of a long term or ready use nature (other than weapons, ammunition and food supplies.

sub_subsystems.title: Utility space
sub_subsystems.definition: Spaces that are designed and specifically fitted out for the storage or provision of utilities.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Spaces that are designed and specifically fitted out for the provision of bathroom and toilet facilities.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Spaces that are designed and specifically fitted out for the maintenance of machinery and certain specialized equipment.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Rooms that are used for carrying out scientific tests on items of equipment and some substances.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Rooms that are used for carrying out tests on items of equipment.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Rooms that are used for preparation and serving of food and refreshments.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Rooms that are used for storage of food and drink, sometimes with specialized storing requirements such as frozen food.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Spaces that are designed and fitted to provide habitable (living and recreational) accommodation.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Spaces in which work of an administrative nature is carried out.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Rooms that are used for the control of operations and/or processes.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Spaces that contain permanent and fixed items of machinery.

subsystems.title: Medical, dental and pharmaceutical spaces, General

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Rooms that are used for the provision of medical, dental and pharmaceutical facilities.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Spaces that are designed and specially fitted for the washing and drying of linen and fabrics.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system or equipment used to provide training capabilities.

sub_subsystems.title: Training
sub_subsystems.definition: The training element is defined as the deliverable training services, devices, accessories, aids, equipment and facilities used to enable instruction through which personnel will acquire sufficient concepts, skill and aptitudes to operate and maintain the system with maximum efficiency. This element includes all effort associated with the design, development and production of deliverable training equipment as well as the execution of training services.

sub_subsystems.title: Non weapon trainers and simulators
sub_subsystems.definition: A system or equipment used to provide training capabilities for non weapon systems and simulators

sub_subsystems.title: Weapon systems trainers and simulators
sub_subsystems.definition: A system or equipment used to provide training capabilities for weapon systems and simulators.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system, equipment or facilities used to maintain operational capability.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system, equipment or facilities used to manage the totality of complex integrated management systems.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system, equipment or facilities used to monitor and manage the totality of Power systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Operator facilities
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the roles and facilities provided to the operator at the Consoles by the MMI

sub_subsystems.title: Data processing
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to equipment fitted to a platform, which combines and processes Power systems data

sub_subsystems.title: Consoles
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the consoles fitted to the platform.

sub_subsystems.title: Monitor
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the equipment fitted to the platform which monitors systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Cabinets
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to Equipment Cabinets, which can be configured with equipment units from multiple systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Maintainer facilities
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the Maintainers and Diagnostic facilities fitted to the platform

sub_subsystems.title: Peripheral equipment
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to any peripheral support equipment fitted to the platform (eg; printers).

subsystems.title: Combat management and data transfer system, General

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system, equipment or facilities used to a platform which combines, processes, and distributes Central Maintenance System (CMS) Data.

sub_subsystems.title: Operator facilities
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the roles and facilities provided to the operator at the Consoles by the MMI.

sub_subsystems.title: Combat management
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to equipment fitted to a platform, which combines and processes CMS data.

sub_subsystems.title: Consoles
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the consoles fitted to the platform.

sub_subsystems.title: Data transfer
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the DTS equipment fitted to the platform which distributes the CMS data.

sub_subsystems.title: Cabinets
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to Equipment Cabinets, which can be configured with equipment units from multiple systems.

sub_subsystems.title: Maintainer facilities
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the Maintainers and Diagnostic facilities fitted to the platform

sub_subsystems.title: Peripheral equipment
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to any peripheral support equipment fitted to the platform (eg, printers).

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A platform system, equipment or facilities used to collect, process, and distribute meteorological and oceanographic data.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system, equipment or facilities used to collect, process systems, and distribute meteorological data.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system, equipment or facilities used to collect, process systems and distribute oceanographic data.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: A system, equipment or facilities used for the transmission and distribution of meteorological and oceanographic (METOC) data, including ship borne Ethernet.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the equipment used for the collation and processing of METOC data.

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the equipment used for receiving non-ship borne (remote) METOC data (eg, consoles, laptops, etc).

sub_subsystems.title: General
sub_subsystems.definition: Refers to the equipment used for receiving non-ship borne (remote) METOC data.
